alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 1:32PM MST until February 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED TOMORROW... .A winter storm will impact the area tomorrow and tomorrow night, bringing heavy snow to portions of the northern Black Hills and foothills, along with much of northeastern Wyoming. On the northwestern and west central South Dakota plains, strong winds and snow will lead to slippery roads and reduced visibilities, causing travel difficulties. Snow is expected to taper off from northwest to southeast tomorrow evening into the night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TUESDAY TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Central Black Hills. * WHEN...From 2 PM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
